Package com.intellij.util.messages

Interface MessageBusConnection

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Disposable

    public interface MessageBusConnection
extends Disposable
    Aggregates multiple topic subscriptions for particular message bus. I.e. every time a client wants to listen for messages it should grab appropriate connection (or create a new one) and subscribe to particular endpoint.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface com.intellij.openapi.Disposable

        Disposable.Parent

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void deliverImmediately()
      Forces to process any queued but not delivered events.
      void disconnect()
      Disconnects current connections from the message bus and drops all queued but not dispatched messages (if any)
      void setDefaultHandler(MessageHandler handler)
      Allows to specify default handler to use during anonymous subscriptions.
      <L> void subscribe(Topic<L> topic)
      Subscribes to the target topic within the current connection using default handler.
      <L> void subscribe(Topic<L> topic, L handler)
      Subscribes given handler to the target endpoint within the current connection.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.intellij.openapi.Disposable

        dispose

    • Method Detail

      • subscribe

        <L> void subscribe(Topic<L> topic,
                   L handler)
            throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Subscribes given handler to the target endpoint within the current connection.
        Type Parameters:
        L - interface for working with the target topic
        Parameters:
        topic - target endpoint
        handler - target handler to use for incoming messages
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if there is already registered handler for the target endpoint within the current connection. Note that that previously registered handler is not replaced by the given one then
        See Also:
        MessageBus.syncPublisher(Topic), com.intellij.application.Topics#subscribe

      • subscribe

        <L> void subscribe(Topic<L> topic)
            throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Subscribes to the target topic within the current connection using default handler.
        Type Parameters:
        L - interface for working with the target topic
        Parameters:
        topic - target endpoint
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if default handler hasn't been defined or has incompatible type with the topic's business interface or if target topic is already subscribed within the current connection

      • setDefaultHandler

        void setDefaultHandler(MessageHandler handler)
        Allows to specify default handler to use during anonymous subscriptions.
        Parameters:
        handler - handler to use

      • deliverImmediately

        void deliverImmediately()
        Forces to process any queued but not delivered events.
        See Also:
        MessageBus.syncPublisher(Topic)

      • disconnect

        void disconnect()
        Disconnects current connections from the message bus and drops all queued but not dispatched messages (if any)
